response.message: Is it possible in some way to have a banner on the "content site" referring to the moderator nomination post on the corresponding meta site, in order to make site members aware of it. It might be that not all site visitors are also frequent visitors of the meta site.

We've updated the about pages to automatically reflect the new pro tem moderators:

http://webapps.stackexchange.com/about
http://gaming.stackexchange.com/about
http://webmasters.stackexchange.com/about
http://cooking.stackexchange.com/about
http://gadgets.stackexchange.com/about
http://gamedev.stackexchange.com/about

Congratulations all!

(and more to come!)
Some new sites have come online recently and could use some moderators. Any thoughts to giving those the same treatment? Android, for instance?
Great article. Just a note, You have to make sure your moderators aren’t power-mad because your members will end up leaving. Why would they stick around to be treated unfairly? Keep that in mind.

you might want to tie moderators to some goal of creating an upswing in community growth/maturation metrics.  It seems like some are more interested in kicking out questions that don't meet some pre-arranged guidelines than making the site relevant for the users.  Is there a way to change course for sites that don't grow?
